title: Calories in a Cup of Sugar
meta_description: Discover calories in sugar cup, including full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, totals for 1 cup, and simple tweaks for variations like brown or powdered sugar.
h1: Calories in a Cup of Sugar
assumptions: Granulated white sugar; 1 cup ≈ 200 g by volume; no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by sugar type, brand, packing density, and measurement; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of granulated sugar provides ~774 kcal, entirely from carbohydrates.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use powdered sugar (looser pack, ≈120 g per cup)

faqs.q: How many calories in a cup of sugar?
faqs.a: About 774 kcal for 1 cup (200 g) granulated white sugar.

faqs.q: Is all the calories in sugar from carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, 100% carbohydrates—200 g carbs per cup, with 0 g protein or fat.

faqs.q: How much sugar is in a cup?
faqs.a: 1 cup granulated sugar weighs ≈200 g and contains 200 g of sugars.

faqs.q: Does sugar type affect calories per cup?
faqs.a: Slightly—brown sugar ≈760 kcal/cup; powdered ≈466 kcal/cup due to lower weight.

faqs.q: Any sodium or cholesterol in sugar?
faqs.a: Negligible sodium (≈2 mg per cup); 0 mg cholesterol.
